After White's pawn push [h2h3], my bishop on g4 is under attack. Retreating to **[g4h5]** maintains the bishop's attacking potential on the diagonal and avoids immediate exchanges. However, greater danger lurks—White’s king remains exposed on d1 and the d-file presents tactical opportunities.

**🔺 [d5f4] is decisive!**

Between ♗h5 (passive retreat) or ♘f4 (winning initiative), ♘f4 converts Black’s central dominance into a killing blow.
